API¶

oclubs Module.

Service Access¶

oclubs Module.

oclubs.access.done(commit=True)[source]¶

Finish a request.

Parameters:commit (bool) – If true, save the data; else discard it.

Main Relational Database¶

Module to access main relational database, which is currently MariaDB.

This module compiles SQL statements with security in mind, executes them, and returns data from the execution.

class oclubs.access.database.RawSQL(sql)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to signal a raw SQL part of a query. - DANGEROUS!

Parameters:sql (basestring) – the raw SQL to use
sql¶

The raw SQL passed in.

oclubs.access.database.delete_rows(table, conds)[source]¶

Execute a DELETE on a table.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • conds (list or dict) – conditions
Returns:

number of rows deleted
Return type:

int or long
Raises:

NoRow – if no row was deleted
oclubs.access.database.expand_cond(cond)[source]¶

Change the input SQL condition into a dict.

Parameters:cond (list or dict) – the input SQL matching condition
Return type:dict
oclubs.access.database.fetch_info(info)[source]¶

Execute a simple SELECT without a table.

Parameters:info (basestring) – the information to select
Returns:the selected information
oclubs.access.database.fetch_multirow(table, coldict, conds, **kwargs)[source]¶

Execute a SELECT on a table, returning the value for rows.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • coldict (dict) – column specification, with keys as the column name and values as the corresponding keys of the returned dic
  • conds (list or dict) – conditions
Returns:

the selected rows
Return type:

list of dict
oclubs.access.database.fetch_onecol(table, col, conds, **kwargs)[source]¶

Execute a SELECT on a table, returning the values for a column.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • col (basestring) – column name
  • conds (list or dict) – conditions
Returns:

the selected column
Return type:

list
oclubs.access.database.fetch_oneentry(table, col, conds, **kwargs)[source]¶

Execute a SELECT on a table, returning the value for an entry.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • col (basestring) – column name
  • conds (list or dict) – conditions
Returns:

the selected entry
Raises:

NoRow – if no row was selected
oclubs.access.database.fetch_onerow(table, coldict, conds, **kwargs)[source]¶

Execute a SELECT on a table, returning the value for a row.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • coldict (dict) – column specification, with keys as the column name and values as the corresponding keys of the returned dict
  • conds (list or dict) – conditions
Returns:

the selected row, with keys specified in coldict
Return type:

dict
Raises:

NoRow – if no row was selected
oclubs.access.database.insert_or_update_row(table, insert, update)[source]¶

Execute an INSERT on a table, with ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • coldict (dict) – inserted data, with keys as the column name and values as the corresponding values
  • update (dict) – updated data, with keys as the column name and values as the corresponding values
Returns:

the id of the inserted row
Return type:

int or long
oclubs.access.database.insert_row(table, insert)[source]¶

Execute an INSERT on a table.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • insert (dict) – inserted data, with keys as the column name and values as the corresponding values
Returns:

the id of the inserted row
Return type:

int or long
Raises:

AlreadyExists – if the row already exists and insertion would result in duplicate keys
oclubs.access.database.update_row(table, update, conds)[source]¶

Execute an UPDATE on a table.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • update (dict) – updated data, with keys as the column name and values as the corresponding values
  • conds (list or dict) – conditions
Returns:

number of rows updated
Return type:

int or long
Raises:

NoRow – if no row was updated

SHSID Authoritative Database¶

Module to access SHSID authortative database, which is currently IBM DB2.

Only accessing student data is implemented.

oclubs.access.db2.allstudents()[source]¶

Get information on all students in grade 9 - 12.

Returns:student information, with each student a dict in the list
Return type:list of dict

Search Engine¶

Module to access Elasticsearch search engine.

This module has delayed functions to create/update/delete documents on the engine, and to search within all the documents.

oclubs.access.elasticsearch.create(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create an Elasticsearch document.

Parameters:
  • doc_type (basestring) – document type
  • doc_id – document id, will be converted into basestring
  • data (dict) – new document data
oclubs.access.elasticsearch.delete(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Delete an Elasticsearch document.

Parameters:
  • doc_type (basestring) – document type
  • doc_id – document id, will be converted into basestring
oclubs.access.elasticsearch.get(doc_type, doc_id, fields=True)[source]¶

Get an Elasticsearch document.

Parameters:
  • doc_type (basestring) – document type
  • doc_id – document id, will be converted into basestring
  • fields – if False, returns whether the document is found as bool; if True, returns the document dict; if list of string, returns the document dict with only the specified fields.
Return type:

dict or bool
oclubs.access.elasticsearch.search(querystr, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Search for Elasticsearch documents.

Parameters:
  • querystr (basestring) – query string
  • doc_type (basestring) – document type
  • doc_id – document id, will be converted into basestring
  • fields (list of basestring) – fields to search on
  • offset (int) – search offset
  • size (int) – search size
Returns:

  • ‘instead’ (basestring or None): the alternative search query
  • ‘results’ (list of dict): list of documents
  • ‘count’ (int): the number of all matching documents
Return type:

dict
oclubs.access.elasticsearch.update(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update an Elasticsearch document.

Parameters:
  • doc_type (basestring) – document type
  • doc_id – document id, will be converted into basestring
  • data (dict) – new document data

Send Email¶

Module to send emails.

This module sends emails with either Postfix or SendGrid.

oclubs.access.email.send(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Send an email.

Parameters:
  • to_email (tuple) – email recipient address and name
  • subject (basestring) – email subject
  • content (basestring) – email content

Filesystem¶

Filesystem helpers.

oclubs.access.fs.watch(path)[source]¶

Watch a file on the filesystem. If something else errors, delete the file.

Parameters:path (str) – path to the file to watch

Redis¶

Module to access Redis key-value storage.

Access is in a object fashion, with objects instantiated with the key. The serialization is done with JSON.

class oclubs.access.redis.ImmutableMixin(value=u'')[source]¶

Bases: object

Mixin to work with immutable types on redis.

Parameters:value – initial value
get()[source]¶

Get value.

set(value)[source]¶

Set value.

class oclubs.access.redis.RedisCache[source]¶

Bases: oclubs.access.redis.RedisStuff, oclubs.access.redis.ImmutableMixin

An immutable object on Redis for indirect access.

serialize(obj)[source]¶
class oclubs.access.redis.RedisDict[source]¶

Bases: oclubs.access.redis.RedisStuff, dict

A dict on Redis.

class oclubs.access.redis.RedisList[source]¶

Bases: oclubs.access.redis.RedisStuff, list

A list on Redis.

class oclubs.access.redis.RedisStuff[source]¶

Bases: object

Superclass of all redis stuffs.

Parameters:
  • key (basestring) – redis key
  • timeout (int) – timeyt in seconds for the key, negative values are forever.
detach()[source]¶

No longer have access.done() operate on this object.

static load(key)[source]¶

Load a value from Redis.

Parameters:key (basestring) – redis key
Returns:the value associated with the key
Return type:basestring
Raises:KeyError – if key is not found
modified¶

bool indicating if value has been modified.

save()[source]¶

Save data to redis.

Parameters:obj – object to serialize

Parameters:data (basestring) – data to unserialize

Secrets¶

Module to read from screts.ini.

oclubs.access.secrets.get_secret(name)[source]¶

Read a secret from secrets.ini.

Parameters:name (basestring) – name of the secret
Returns:value of the secret
Return type:basestring

Site configuration¶

Module to access site configuration in siteconfig.ini.

oclubs.access.siteconfig.get_config(name)[source]¶

Get a site configuration boolean.

Parameters:name (basestring) – name of site configuration
Returns:value of site configuration
Return type:bool
oclubs.access.siteconfig.set_config(name, value)[source]¶

Set a site configuration boolean.

Parameters:
  • name (basestring) – name of site configuration
  • value (bool) – new value of site configuration

Write this temporary object into database and Elasticsearch.

Also set the id of the object to its corresponding id in the database, making the object permanent.

Write this temporary object into database and Elasticsearch.

Also set the id of the object to its corresponding id in the database, making the object permanent.

Parameters:dup_key_update (bool) – if True, when a unique key collides, update the colliding row with new data; else raise the error
Returns:this object
Raises:AlreadyExists – if insertion results in a unique key collision and dup_key_update is False

Base¶

oclubs Base Object.

class oclubs.objs.base.BaseObject[source]¶

Bases: object

create(dup_key_update=False)¶

Write this temporary object into database and Elasticsearch.

Also set the id of the object to its corresponding id in the database, making the object permanent.

Parameters:dup_key_update (bool) – if True, when a unique key collides, update the colliding row with new data; else raise the error
Returns:this object
Raises:AlreadyExists – if insertion results in a unique key collision and dup_key_update is False
id¶

ID of the object.

is_real¶

Whether the object is temporary object (False) or permanent (True).

classmethod new()[source]¶

Returns a new temporary object for creation.

class oclubs.objs.base.ListProperty(prop, table, this, that, ie=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a list of value in the specified column in another table.

Selection is done by the id of the owner object match the value in the column specified by this in the specified table, and extraction is done on the column specified by that.

Parameters:
  • table (basestring) – table name
  • this (basestring) – column name to match the id with
  • that (basestring) – column name to return values with
  • ie (a single value of, or a tuple with two values of, None, NotImplemented, basestring, a serializer module, BaseObject, Enum, or callable) – import/export method, onlt the export part matters
class oclubs.objs.base.Property(prop, dbname, ie=None, search=False, rediscached=False, search_require_true=False, error_default=Ellipsis)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a value in the specified column of the current table.

Selection is done by the id of the owner object match the value in the identifier column in the current table.

Parameters:
  • dbname (basestring) – column name in relational database
  • ie (a single value of, or a tuple with two values of, None, NotImplemented, basestring, a serializer module, BaseObject, Enum, or callable) – import/export method
  • search (bool) – whether the column should be searchable
  • rediscached (bool) – whether the column should be cached on Redis
  • search_require_true (bool) – if True, the object will only be searchable if this column evaluates to True
  • error_default – if not Ellipsis, when the importing fails, import this value as a fallback; else raise the error
oclubs.objs.base.paged_db_read(func)[source]¶

Decorator function to have a database read with paging abilities.
